heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 11th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 5 consecutive days beginning 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 812 m), light levels (up 4898 lux), feels like temperature (up 4.5°C), and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 337.4m lower than yesterday, 362.6m lower than the past week, 812.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 939m and a high of 3180m, averaging 1448.8m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
